intro: Ditassa heterostemma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value.
